story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Nigeria, there was a kind and curious little boy named Tani. Tani lived with his family in a cozy hut near a lush forest filled with exotic animals and plants. Tani's father was a wise and respected elder in the village, and he loved to share stories with his son before bedtime.

One night, Tani asked his father, "Baba, why do the stars twinkle in the sky?"

Baba smiled at his son's curiosity and began to tell him a story.

"Long ago, when the world was young, the sky was a dark and empty place. The animals of the forest were sad because they had no guidance or protection during the long, dark nights.

The wise tortoise, who had lived since the creation of the world, decided to consult with the Sky King, the mighty god who ruled over the heavens. The tortoise journeyed for many days, crossing treacherous rivers and climbing steep mountains until he reached the Sky King's palace.

'Oh, wise Sky King,' said the tortoise, 'the animals of the forest are in need of your guidance and protection. They are lost and afraid during the long, dark nights. Please, can you send down some light?'

The Sky King was moved by the tortoise's words and decided to send down light in the form of tiny fireflies. However, the Sky King wanted to make sure that the fireflies would always remember their purpose and not wander away.

'I will make a special deal with the fireflies,' said the Sky King. 'If they agree to light up the night sky for the animals of the forest, I will grant them a special gift. They will be able to dance and twinkle in the night sky, spreading joy and light to all who look upon them.'

The fireflies agreed, and from that day forward, they lit up the night sky, bringing guidance and protection to the animals of the forest. And that is why the stars twinkle in the sky, my dear Tani â€“ it is the fireflies' dance, a reminder of their agreement with the Sky King."

Tani's eyes widened with wonder as his father finished the story. He looked up at the twinkling stars and smiled, feeling grateful for their light and warmth. And with that, he drifted off to sleep, dreaming of fireflies and the Sky King's wisdom.

The end.
